Well, whenever he wakes up and discovers its still Groundhog Day, you just feel how he feels. He's so good at it. You feel so sorry for him. And then how he goes through each Groundhog Day is just so funny with Bill Murray. How he puts up with it all and struggles and struggles! I don't want to spoil anything this time so I better stop here.But I defiantly recommended seeing this movie because all you need to know about this movie this that Bill Murray is super funny, people!

reviews.review_title: A deep and beautiful message in a funny and always appropriate movie.
reviews.content: I would like to express myself on one of the greatest and maybe most underrated movies ever made. Contained within is a deep and beautiful message that everyone should take example from.Starting out as a sarcastic comedy, Bill Murray is Phil Connors, a self-absored and cynical weatherman. He's trying to climb the television network ladder, and though he might be on his way up, he still got a task to do that he hates above everything else. Every year, the famous Groundhog day in Punxsutawney takes place, and Phil has to make a cute report about this event. Of course, in Phils vocabulary "cute" is a synonym for "pathetic".He travels there with a news team, the cameraman Larry (Chris Elliott) and Rita (Andie Macdowell), the total opposite of Phil. She is a kind, warm and gentle person. Naturally, there is a big clash between Phil and her.They arrive at Punxsutawney, and Phil does a short and arrogant report and leaves shortly thereafter, to Ritas big annoyance. However, a snow storm forces Phil to stay one more night in his "favourite" town.Next morning he wakes up early, eager to leave this extremely cute and happy place. He looks out the window, and sees a very familiar sight. It's Groundhog Day! Out on the street, he becomes perplexed and yet convinced that this is the exactly same day as yesterday. Same things happen in same order. He manages to keep sane however, and falls asleep in the evening. Next day he wakes up to exactly the same song on the radio... Rise and shine, it's Groundhog day!I'm amazed how much truth and wisdom story writer Danny Rubin has put into this movie. First, Phil realize that he can do anything and no one can stop him. He tries out virtually every capital sin, only to realize that this is not it. After a while, he comes to the conclusion that the big change must happen within himself.It's this conclusion I feel is the most important, as it reflects the civilization and humanity every day. We can go cursing the situation around us, but that only ends up in torturing ourselves. We have to realize that one of the few things we really have control over is, that's right, ourself. And as shown in Phil's change after this realization, everything is within us. It's only a question of letting it out and stop the feelings that makes us feel bad.I'm not saying this is easy, it could be a lifelong process (or LOTS of Groundhog days), where you slowly have to realize that "this place might help me do something about myself". So was the story about Phil, anyway. Does he ever get out of his "personal hell"? Well, go rent the movie and find out!

Bill Murray is one of the funniest guys in the movies, and I think that this is his best! The best part is when That Ned guy tries to sell him insurance again and he socks him in the face! One of the best comedies of the decade! Yeah!

I won't say this is the greatest movie of all times since you will most likely disagree with me, but in my world it sure is.Back in good old Sweden this movie was very poorly marketed, but luckily some friends of mine discovered this movie a few years after its premiere and it quickly became our favorite movie. The basic genre of the movie is the "romantic comedy" genre, which is flooded by enjoyable but very average movies that makes time fly by without leaving any major impressions. I believe the genre also is the curse of Groundhog Day, people are supposed to leave their brains shut of when watching these kind of movies and no one is supposed to love romantic comedies, you are meant to like them. In my view Groundhog Day is the most underestimated work of art in the movie history....(or it might be that people simply have different tastes and just don't love the movie as I do, but when it comes to Groundhog Day I don't like that kind of thoughts ;) )The movie is about the art of enjoying your everyday life.... ....or it is a philosophical what-if-movie, about the eventuality of someone having to relive the same day over and over again, reflecting on the moral and psychological consequences... ...or it is a beautiful romantic film where someone manages to change into a better person in order to charm the woman of his dreams... ...or a hilarious comedy that makes you breathless while trying to stop laughing.If you don't like some of the different aspects of the film simply ignore them, you will still enjoy the movie.Groundhog Day is in my view the most obvious 10/10 movie. And I strongly recommend it to anyone, hopingly you will love it too and if you don't you will surely like it.
Great comedy concept, and perfectly executed at that. If you love repetitive feel-good movies with a sadistic twist, watch this one, over, and over, and over, and over.... If not, watch it anyway.

reviews.review_title: It had a heart and a good story
reviews.content: Groundhog day may seem tame by today's standards- but remember this was the film that started the whole time relapse continuum in the first place. However, just a concept cannot carry a film and this is where Groundhog succeeded and many others failed- It had a heart and a good story. Bill murray plays a weather reporter who must relive the same day- groundhog day every day. Featuring great performances from Murray and Mcdonald, and fantastic direction from Harold Ramis Groundhog Day is a movie that will still be watched a hundred years from now. (Great comedy-philosophical drama).

A movie about a man stuck in a small town reliving the same day over and over again, should be boring, should be annoying, should be way to repetitive to be interesting. Groundhog day is not only interesting, it is wonderful.This is a brilliant comedy with a terrific cast. Bill Murray is naturally funny and Andie McDowell is naturally beautiful. The repetitive nature of this movie, actually works in a way that gives you an opportunity to see it over and over again, without catching everything in 1 particular viewing. As a result, this movie gets better every time you watch it, simply because we get to do what the main character does, we get a chance to get it right.

The cast in this film is perfect but the story makes the film. Is it about optimism? The affectionate tension builds, beginning low-key and subtly, between the cynicism and pessimism of Bill Murray's weatherman, Phil, and the tolerant accommodation of his producer, Rita(Andie McDowell), not to mention the general good-cheer of the townsfolk.But does Phil have to become an optimist to win Rita's heart?Or is there something else going on here?Is it even about learning how to do a myriad of things, just in order to impress the girl?Phil is definitely your true-to-life cynic. But what it is that finally changes Phil, in the end?The focus narrows as he refines his technique, his approach, his way of thinking.What finally is it, that changes Phil?And what finally enables Phil, and Rita, to make it through to the next day, breaking the spell?It isn't because they were able to stay up all night, through to 6 a.m.Because it shows they were clearly asleep when the clock announces a new day.

reviews.review_title: The last 40 minutes was so deep.
reviews.content:
Initially it seems like a banal comic film, but every passing minute takes on an ever deeper meaning. Superb acting for Bill Murray.
Advice.

reviews.review_title: A good movie with a good storyline. Nothing too flash
reviews.content: I always knew what this movie was about but never got the chance to watch it. I was very expectant of this film when I finally got around to watching it however I thought Bill Murray would be way funnier rather than the sarcastic person he was in the film, that was my only disappointment. But it was a great film, with a great storyline and an even better ending!I would recommend it to the general audience, this is just a unique movie that anyone can watch really. Light comedy for the family and it's a movie worth watching! Makes you appreciate your day more!This film was a good film. A good movie with a good storyline with good characters and a good ending. Only bad point was there was so much sarcasm but who wouldn't if you were in his situation. This movie is sort of like Cool Runnings in a way that anyone can watch it and anyone will enjoy! A good, decent movie!

An hilarious romantic comedy that tells a beautiful story by depicting awful truths. It's Bill Murray at his best, and it has an unquestionably powerful message that can be appreciated and, at the same time, enjoyed.

It is an easy going romance comedy drama but with a deeper meaning. The meaning of the film is that, we have to make good choices in our miserable, boring routines so that we can alter the futire and become a better version of ourselves. This simplistic message thoufh is given in a very clever and not prosaic way.

But somehow, in this movie, he's great. Go figure. The bit with the groundhog is gold. His numerous suicides are hilarious. I love the look on his face when he realizes it's groundhog day, AGAIN.I bought the movie, it was just too delicious. I'm surprised they didn't do a follow up movie.

This has got to be the worst movie ever! Okay maybe the second worst ever. I like Bill Murray most of they time, Andy McDowell okay, usually too gooey sweet. But this is just stupid. How in the world does this thing get an 8 out of 10? No wonder it took 28 years for to watch and now I want my 1:45 hours back, big time.

Witty, original, romantic - what more do you want? Definitely one of those "two level" films - you can enjoy it just for Murray's hilarious antics and the sharp script, but this a story that is really about something. Most attempts at the Redemption theme end up being either heavy handed or so platitudinous that you want to throw up. Here Ramis handles it so deftly you will wonder if this really is the same buffoon from SCTV.If you have not seen it, I'm envious. Watch for the Jeopardy scene - an absolute classic.

I think this movie continues to get better with age. It has moments that are meaningful and profound. It also is fun and lighthearted. I have watched it several times over the years after seeing it in theaters when it released. I hope Hollywood can capture this type of magic again. It continues to live on in perpetuity as people quote it and talk about it even thirty years later. See it if you have the opportunity to. You won't be disappointed. Bill Murray should have won an Oscar for this. He shows a complete transformation of his character over the course of the film. If you haven't watched it recently, watch it again.

Of itself, the movie missed perfection. But the idea saved a relationship. Being a man, I often say the wrong thing. I had made a terrible mistake in telling a close friend -- happened to be a woman -- something that totally upset her. The only thing that saved the relationship was being able to ask her for another chance like the one given to Phil Connors in the movie. Since then, when I say or do something stupid, I can get a second chance by asking for another Groundhog Day.

What to say about this one? I still remember the day I watched it the first time on my parents' TV. I could not stop laughing when Bill Murray keeps waking up the same day. So many great ideas in this movie.

What would you do if you had to wake up day after day and find that it's still the day before? Would you repeat your actions or change them? What if you try to kill yourself after a while, only to find that again you wake up the next day (same day!) as usual? Bill Murray is terrific in his role as an unlikeable journalist who --------------SPOILER AHEAD-------- during those first repeated days tries to take advantage of his knowledge of the day's activities, only to gradually makes himself into a better person day by day. The first time I saw this movie, I thought it was simply silly and fun. Seeing it again recently, I appreciated the way it made me think about the choices we make every single day. Clever and memorable.

Comedies that can also convey sentiment are hard to find.  Good ones, that is.  This is a very funny movie. I have watched it several times and appreciate something new with each viewing.  Basically, it's about a guy named Phil (played by Billy Murray) reliving the same day over and over again. His romantic interest, played by Andie McDowell, represents a brick wall he keeps smashing himself against  until  figuring out that he has to be happy with himself and what he has instead of what he wants.  I usually can't stand "feel good" movies, but this movie is  touching.  A man nobody likes ends up epitomizing all the things that make a person good. 
Many people feel like they are living the same day over and over again, and in relating to Phil's self-inflicted plight, they laugh out loud at his frustrations and misery.  In truth, many people are living the same day over and over again because, like the main character, they make the same mistakes over and over again.   What makes it so interesting is how it exposes the problems-and hilarity of such problems- that a lot of men have.  Phil learns to appreciate what IS. He learns that if another person can be "conquered" that they weren't worth conquering to begin with; that the grass isn't always greener on the other side.  True happiness comes from within.  Blah, blah, blah and so forth. I can't imagine the film with anyone other than Murray. With miraculous insight, he exploits the introspective, narcissistic humor of the story. The two work brilliantly together, exposing an ironic, self deprecating charm before it's over.

Groundhog Day, by Harold Ramis is brilliant! Rightfully so, a lot of the comedy is based on the ridiculousness of the actual day. One of my favorites as it has it all: Laughs, love, action, despair. It's one of those script concepts that writes itself with the premise. This film alone created the notion of groundhogs day as a measure of deja-vu and stuck-ness.Groundhogs day is arguably Murray's best work as an actor as his performance does what many comedians can't- he breaks through the humor and really hugs drama. (For the record- Lost in translation also comes close for me in terms of Murray's talent.)The film does a great job at engaging the audience and makes them consider the effects of ego-driven selfishness. It encourages viewers to be good to those around you, for goodnesses sake. It says, Don't just try to go though the motions and run away from the things and places you think you hate. If you'd just slow down, be present and make the best of the life you have in front of you, you may be surprised to find that you get the girl, the towns respect and personal enjoyment, i.e., Joy. In the end, when it's finally February third/ tomorrow, Murray's character Phil exclaims "let's live here".Groundhog Day is brilliantly written and directed by Harold- by far his best work. He estimates the amount of time that Murray's character is stuck in Punxsutawney is ten years! It's definitely a film that I have to watch at least once every year. There's really no film like it- RIP Harold. Cheers to your art good sir."

reviews.review_title: A fantastic concept, brilliantly cast and wonderfully directed.
reviews.content: A film that was perhaps underrated by critics upon its release, Groundhog Day is a classic example of a film that has spread through word of mouth. Bill Murray is perfectly cast as the grumpy weatherman whose egotistical character would rather be in the studio than out on location. Andie MacDowell is equally great as the kind and caring 'environmentally friendly' love interest that contrasts diligently with Murrays bullish persona. The concept is something that almost every person has toyed with at one point or another - what would happen if tomorrow I woke up and re-lived today. With this in mind Groundhog Day manages to investigate this notion with humour, wit and a sense of class that makes it stand out as a great movie that will, I'm sure, endure the very thing it explores - time.

reviews.review_title: I Think I'm to Young to get the Humour in this...
reviews.content: Don't Get me wrong I think Bill Murry is hilarious in most of his films even his older ones, I mean who doesn't love the original Ghostbusters? But this film, despite plenty of praise and encouragement from my father just was a little boring for me. I mean I get that not many are going to love this review and no film has ever been loved by everyone but I honestly don't understand the colt following of this.The filmed looked aged even for its time. The acting seemed to be half delivered. The cinematography was very basic and the soundtrack a lot of the time didn't match the scenes. I found myself watching it all only to not offend my dad. The character development of Phil (Bill Murray) was verybpredicable and the love connection seemed to forget that this was over the course of one day plus I don't think that Rita's (Andie MacDowell)character from the start was very much like what she was come the end which doesn't make sense in this particular scenario.However I did enjoy the insanity and suicide montage it was by far the funniest part. I have to admit though he shore did love it and his a tough critic much tougher then me so it has to still be a good film.

A wonderful film. We have a family tradition of watching this movie once a year -- on Groundhog's Day, of course. A good, clean, funny film (sometimes eerie) with a good message. Good family film. Sweet.

Only one word can resume what this film is: Perfection. This instant comedy classic is a fable about making things go right. Murray plays a weather reporter who wakes up on the same day in a boring town over and over. When the situation becomes a chance the film moves from straight comedy to romantic comedy without a problem. A totally round story, an sensible direction and a nice casting with a fabulous Bill Murray playing his character with a touch of cinisism that never lets the film become corny, and one of the best screenplay that I've ever seen, are the ingredients that makes this film a jewel. "Run Lola Run", the Germanic flick is exactly about the same topic, see both films.

reviews.review_title: One of the best movies ever, a delight
reviews.content: With the notable exception of film critics, everyone who has seen this movie loves it.  It seems that Hollywood is stuck with about seven basic plots. Here's a movie that is totally different. A new idea, a comment on our humanity, a metaphor for our lives, and we're not scolded about our failings, we're allowed to laugh as we learn - what were the critics thinking about with their ho hum reviews?The plot? Bill Murray is a conceited and arrogant Pittsburgh weatherman doomed for all eternity to repeat February 2 in boring Punxatawnie, PA over and over again. At least until he gets it right. What's right? Murray finds out the hard way, and you'll have a delightful trip learning with him. And you might discover something about yourself along the way.Murray is the only person alive who could have pulled off the lead role, and Andie McDowell plays the innocent foil just perfectly. The setting in Punxatawnie is cleverly broadly American. Critic Roger Ebert recently asked why we see no movies about small town Americans who are as lovable and eccentric as those in certain Irish and English settings such as "Waking Ned Divine."  Well here it is Ebert, the characters and the actors portraying them are as eccentric and lovable as they come. They make the movie work.Harold Ramus did absolutely nothing wrong putting this movie together.

This is my favorite film. Its deep meanings are so true and its comedy so fresh that I must give it the most prestigious position I have for a movie. And as a general warning those who dislike or only moderately like this film be prepared for a rougher time becoming my friend. I don't accept that "Groundhog Day" can be simply dismissed as a romance movie or a comedy, because it possesses a messages that are frighteningly profound and applicable to our world.This movie is gold on so many levels and applies so perfectly to my life in almost every sequence that I am not embarrassed to say that I adore this film and am a better person due to its creation. Thank you Danny Rubin, Harold Ramis, Andie MacDowell, and, of course, Bill Murray for making this most excellent film!

reviews.review_title: I loved it, much better than "Cats" I have seen it again and again.
reviews.content: Without a doubt this movie is Bill Murray's finest work to date.  While the movie is hilarious from start to finish, it achieves the level of genius as it captures one man's transformation from an ego-centric weatherman who can't find any meaning in his life, to that of a man content with his simple being.Brian Doyle Murray and Chris Elliot deliver incredible performances in support roles.
Slow in the middle but loved it overall a great classic film
I,m sure I've seen this film before. It was even better the 2nd time, the 3rd time, the 4th time and on and on and on.HAPPY GROUNDHOG DAY!

If this film had been made four decades ago it would not have surprised me to see Frank Capra's name attached to it. This is ironic as one of his most celebrated movies, It's a Wonderful Life was also hugely underrated in its day and in fact was slated by some critics. The difference between these films is that Harold Ramis is not held in the same esteem as Frank Capra, at least not at present. In order for that to happen Harold will need to make a film of the same acclaim as 'Mr Smith goes to Washington'. Things could easily change.Meanwhile 'Groundhog Day is an impressive use of imagination (whilst not perfect) and is one of those 'what if...' wonderfully quirky movies that you find yourselves talking and debating far more than even the most profoundly philosophical of deep thought provoking epics. Pure escapist fun and for once that does not mean some sci fi big budget action blaster.Then there are the performances mostly good solid ones with a glorious subtle piece of acting from Murray, probably his best to date.I could go on but I do not wish to hype it too much for those who have not seen it. I will admit one shameful thing....I gave it 10/10 in order to raise it in the top 250. My true vote would be 9.5 out of 10 !!

reviews.review_title: This one is really a 10 in my mind!
reviews.content: Just got done watching this movie within past hour, and while its been around for a while I had never seen it.  Bill Murray was not one of my favorite actors, but he did an excellent job in this movie.  I hadn't read any information on the movie, so I was surprised with the developments.  It really is worth while watching to see the interaction of the other characters as Murray continues to relive Groundhog Day.  Don't think they could have made any improvements in the movie.  If you haven't seen, rent it, or it may show up on free TV, but watch it!

I agree with those posters who say this is a terrific and underrated movie. One measure of its quality is the fact that people all over the world are still writing long, heartfelt reviews/analyses of the thing almost a decade after its release. At least a few TV programmers must share this fondness for the movie, as it reappears fairly regularly on the tube -- often, I notice, around New Year's Day (not Groundhog Day, oddly), probably because that's the day (other than our birthdays) when we most often reflect on something as abstract as the passage of time. Like an earlier poster, I think it's interesting that we haven't heard a thing from Danny Rubin since he wrote this movie.  Perhaps that was a nom de plume? For who(m)? one wonders. In a way it's sort of attractive to think of this guy suddenly appearing one day in Hollywood with this wonderful, understatedly profound script, handing it to Harold Ramis or whomever, then vanishing, never to be heard from again.  Maybe he realized he wasn't likely to surpass himself. You wonder if he's even a professional writer. He could be a...weatherman, for all we know. Surely somebody somewhere knows what this fellow is doing now, but I kind of want it to remain a mystery. Not that I can improve upon the outpouring of commentary seen already, but I'll mention the movie's suggestion (an assertion, really, though understated) that, had we but world enough and time, we all should inevitably become saints, simply because to follow any other path in life would be boring and pointless. I think it's in the simplicity and certitude of this message that Groundhog Day differs from almost every other movie, even those movies called "uplifting." In Hollywood plots, after all, Good most always triumphs over Evil. But this story seems to imply that the contest between Good and Evil is an illusion: there is no real choice, we can choose to do good now or do good later, but choose it we inevitably must. What a revolutionary statement about life! One isn't very often tempted to use the word "Tolstoyan" to describe creative works of any age, let alone movies from Hollywood in the late 20th Century. Yet there it is: a story that could be said to stand on its head much of Western civilization's ethical and theological teaching, all presented via perfectly timed gags, a beautiful girl, and Bill Murray.  What else do you want in your entertainment?

In addition to all the praise that this movie has received from the other reviewers, I would like to point out that the philosophy of this movie runs pretty deep if you look at it carefully.Is it just me, or does the Bill Murray's predicament in the movie seem to a metaphor for the whole Buddhist belief about reincarnation and breaking out of that never-ending cycle by letting go of desire and achieving Nirvana? Bill Murray is forced to relive the same day and he only moves on when he discovers the compassionate side of himself and stops being selfish.  And, it took many many lifetimes for to do it, just as Buddhists believe we come back many many lifetimes.Just my observation.Regardless of at what level you choose to view this movie, it's a must see.

Bill Murray has to watch the same day go by over and over again and he grows on this "surrealist" experience. The same goes for me with regard to the movie itself: It still reveals new insights even after having watched it for the umpteenth time. This first rate comedy of ideas is not only deeply moving, it's also a perfect treat for a cold, gray and boring winter day.

reviews.review_title: One of the best movies ever made
reviews.content: Yes it's true, this is no mere star vehicle for Bill Murray.  It's a truly ingenius, inventive, funny, and touching comedy-fantasy.  There is so much to love.  Director/co-writer places brilliant touches throughout, particularly in never explaining what causes Phil's time-warp.  It doesn't even really seem to have a purpose at all and the way Phil eventually manipulates his situation and then comes to use it to better himself is so wonderful and organic that it makes this movie practically the best "feel-good" movie since the days of Frank Capra.  And it doesn't even seem sappy!!! Plus there is no shortage of humor- Bill Murray is at the top of his game and Andie MacDowell makes an ideal romantic companion.  Even Chris Elliot (who has been terrible in movies lately) seems funny.This movie is a modern classic and its stature and memory will outlive that of movies like "A Beautiful Mind" or "American Beauty" (two movies you should avoid at all costs).  Among films made in the 1990s, this easily ranks in the top ten and surely among the top 100 of all time.  A must see.

reviews.review_title: To my mind, the most enjoyable Bill Murry movie of all.
reviews.content: Owning this film - "Groundhog Day" - has allowed me the opportunity to view it many times. And with each additional viewing, I gain an ever-increasing appreciation for it's genius. After a hundred years of film-making, it's hard to find a life-situation or story-premise that hasn't been done adnauseam.But this wonderfully original script deals with a whole new arena of comedy, that of living the same day over and over again,..."Groundhog Day". Once he, (Bill Murry) discovers his life has become a continuous replay of the same 24 hour period, it eventually allows him to grow, and learn to perfect his talents and skills to the Benefit of all, and ultimately in the end, to himself. A truly delightful film, one you'll enjoy viewing repeatedly, reliving the same day over and over again, just like the main character in the film.

Groundhog Day is a hilarious tv show that creates dark humor by killing off the main character over and over. I have watched it countless times and am a sucker for how romantic and cheesy it is. I definitely suggest watching this film if you haven't.

I saw this movie at the theater on the first date with the girl I eventually married . Will still watch it every year on the anniversary of our first date and I never tire of it. This is Bill Murray and Harold Ramis at their best. Made at a perfect time with a perfect cast. Thank goodness it wasn't  made today or it would have  probably starred Ben Stiller  and Reese Witherspoon ....nothing against these two actors but  Bill and Andie really make this film work. This movie deserves to be in at least the top 20 of best movies of all time on everyones list!

This may be Bill Murrays best work. In fact,the whole cast is perfect. Chris Eliot as Larry is right on the money and Andie Macdowell is sweetness itself as Rita. The screenplay is excellent, I can't but wonder what happened to this guy Danny Rubin and why nothing else seems to have come out of him. I just love this movie and it always effects me like "Its a Wonderful Life" used to. I've seen it five or six times and am now waiting a year before I watch it again. I believe that 20 years from now, this movie will be considered a "Classic". By the way "Its A Wonderful Life" is still a great movie but I've seen it so many times that I've got to wait 5 years between showings.

I think this is definitely a film which grows on you. Murray plays the same character he always plays, the frustrated and sarcastic cynic who comes to realize that life does have a meaning after all. He comes to love the town he hates, and the people in it. Especially of note are the scenes with the bum, which is really where his 'redemption' begins. Murray plays off the other cast members very well, with most of them there as straight men (& women) to his situation. But what really sells me is the continuity; The same people are in EXACTLY the same places at EXACTLY the same times, every time. Of course, his relationship with McDowell is great as well. Well worth watching twice.

Groundhog Day is undoubtedly one of the best movies I have ever seen.  I will admit by bias.  I think Bill Murray is a comic genius, which is on display in full force in this comic tour de force.Bill Murray plays a disgruntled meteorologist who works for a small-market TV station.  He is embarrassed that he still has to do gigs like the local groundhog festival in a smalltown.  As it happens, the last place that Murray wants to be is the place where he must remain.  He wakes up the morning after to discover that he is reliving the previous day.  With each passing day (the same day that is), Murray realizes that there are no rules for him because each day he is given a second chance.  No rules means no consequences.  He attempts to woo the luminous Andie MacDowell(in her best role), but after repeated failures, he starts killing himself off.  This is the darkly comic part of the movie, especially the kidnapping of Phil the groundhog.I will not spoil the ending, but suffice it to say, it is not disappointing. Murray realizes the meaning of life is not about self; it's about selflessness.  Point being: we live dead-end lives when we live them in selfishness.  We can only escape when we learn to be compassionate, and we can't be loved until we learn to love others ourselves.This is more than mindless entertainment to me.  It is truly an uplifting story, not to mention the fact that it is one of the most romantic movies I've seen.  Without a doubt, Bill Murray is one of our best and most under-appreciated actors.  Watch "Rushmore" if you think I am mistaken. "Groundhog Day" is one for the keeping and cherishing.

reviews.review_title: A movie to watch over and over
reviews.content: This is truly a magnificent movie.I rented it when it first came out and immediately I was hooked. I watched it alone later with a friend and once again alone before returning it.I could write an enormous review about this movie, but I'll keep it short since most of it has been said already anyway.This movie always makes me feel good. One of the most important messages I see is that you should live everyday as if it where your last. It sounds corny I know but bare with me. The character may repeat the same day over and over, but the fact remains that everything he accomplishes, he does so in a single day. In a single day he manages to save lives and make himself loved by everyone. At the end of the movie I am left with a warm feeling. If Phil who started out as a hated and lonely man could turn his live around in (essentially) a single day, then image what I could do.....This makes Groundhog day one my favorite movies ever. To illustrate; since I rented it that first time, I must have seen it 28+ times. I have it on tape myself, and every time it is shown on TV I just can not resist.If you haven't seen this movie..  SHAME on YOU !! :-)

Not sure why everyone calls this a classic. There were a couple of laughs but for the most part, I was bored with it. The movie was about him reliving the same day over and over. Yet, I got upset because he was reliving the same day over and over. Scrooged is actually one of my favorite Bill Murray movies.

reviews.review_title: "Groundhog Day" reminds me "In Dreams Begin Responsibilities"
reviews.content: "In Dreams" is the famous short story by Delmore Schwartz in which a young man tries to make sense of his family."Groundhog" perhaps can best be analyzed as a series of dreams, or one long dream, of Phil Connors as he tries to make sense of his life and conduct.The film does not really work when seen in any other way.Because it is a dream there are inconsistencies, and abrupt stops and starts.Clearly Phil has deep interest in Madonna-like Rita from the start, and his love is consummated in the dream. In real life too? Who knows.As many have said, movies are very like dreams.I believe I have written 10 lines so will submit this for posting.

Clearly the film-makers simply didn't have enough material for afeature. They simply kept repeating the plot of a ten minute shortover and over ad nauseum, with a few minor changes! Dismal andirritating . Groundhog Day is an insult to your intelligence. Saveyourself time: just watch ten minutes of it. Then imagine theresulting movie if that ten minutes was repeated.... over and overand over over over.

We don't know who or what is behind Phil the weatherman's entry into The Twilight Zone, where each day resets to the same day upon waking up to a radio alarm clock. Space aliens? God? Loki? Satan? Who would objectify and manipulate the lives of so many people just to affect one man?But who or what is irrelevant. Experiencing Phil's progression of emotions and reactions after each same day is fascinating and often hysterical.Well-made, thoughtful, detailed, funny, well-performed, and one of my favorite movies. See it. See it again. And again...
I knew all about the film, had heard about it, just never actually watched it.The main message of the film? To impress a woman you need to literally move the earth. super. Bill Murray's cool.

Groundhog day is one of the greatest comedies ever. The wonderful cast obviously loves the script and gives a great perfomance. The plot may not appeal to people who hate scifi-elements. It does though keep the rest of us thrilled again and again and again and...

I just watched the movie for the umpteenth time. It never fails to make me laugh, it never fails to move me as a story, it never fails to impress me as a movie.I haven't read all 397 comments (I do have a life), but in the first couple of pages I noticed nobody spoke of the 7 stages of grief/dying. The screenplay uses this as a plot device. The next time you watch the film (I know you will), check out Murray's character as he goes through 1)Shock/disbelief, 2)Denial, 3)Bargaining, 4)Guilt, 5)Anger, 6)Depression and, finally, 7)Acceptance. Only when he reaches acceptance and becomes the beloved Phil known to the whole town, who loves Rita unconditionally with neither an agenda nor a timetable, do the fates release him to live in the present.The screenplay is positively rife with beautifully understated lines that crack me up. Many commentors have included their favorites. Mine is the bowling alley scene in which the guy responds to Murray and says, "That about sums it up." There's a long list of continuity goofs, but there's never been a movie in which they are more inconsequential. It's the massive continuity that does work that's the story here.Easily on my personal Top Ten list.

The insane idea of having Bill Murray play a tv-weatherman who has to go to a small backwater town to cover the appearance of the Groundhog makes for some excellent laughs in this Harold Ramis/Bill Murray-comedy.Bill Murray obviously enjoys himself playing cynical weatherman Phil Connors and it is without a doubt Murray's dry, cynical performance that saves Groundhog Day from being just another Hollywood comedy.The underlying morality of the movie to me seems a bit over the top. Far from disliking movies with a message, at times it was simply a bit too moralizing. I definitely watch this movie for the excellent performance by Murray, and others should as well. If they get a kick out of the moralizing undercurrent it's just great - I just don't dig it that much (but yes - I *do* agree with the message of the movie!)..

reviews.review_title: A disturbingly unforgettable film. A rare gem.
reviews.content: This is one of the few films that I watch over and over. If Purgatory or Hell exist, this tale has a place in them as a hard scenario.At first it seems a standard comedy but then it quickly darkens to one of the best horror films made. More of the horrible fate of this man unfolds as you pick up the comments and innuendo. Only at the end does the viewer realize that the victim has spent the equivalent of many lifetimes in the one-day loop, with no hope of release, even death is not granted to him.When he is finally released, a rebuilt and different man, I want to cheer.Recommended viewing.

This is one of my most favourite films. Every time I watch this, it brings me back to the innocence and charm that only films in the 90s seemed to have. Other films which contained this magic are ones like Mrs Doubtfire and Hook. Every time I watch this movie, I always imagined what it would be like to live in this nice small tight-knit community.The film explores most of the possibilities on how you would take advantage of being able to re-live the same day over and over again. But also the caulse where you can't kill yourself to escape it. The film offers a strong moral at the end of it which is, be nice to people and live every day to its fullest.The fact that the writers don't explain why the timeloop occurs just adds to the mystery and is definitely one of those moments where it's best not to explain it. I think thats the problem of films today, everything has to be spelt out with an explanation. Sometimes it's best for the viewer to make up their own mind.Overall a great film, I wish Harold Ramis still made films. Bill Murray's well timed humour is what really drives this film, and it's this film that made me fall in love with this actor. It's a good, wellrounded, family film.

Phil Connors,a sarcastic weather man disappointed from his boring life the 2nd of February of every year goes to a lost little city in Pennsilvanya to shoot a reportage about an old local tradition "The Groundhog day",where a nice big rat,like Phil calls it,seems able to preview the last of the winter and the came of the spring..but this time something of really strange happens,Phil ,for a joke of the destiny (or who knows what else..)is obliged to live the same day for hundred of times ,so every day ,for his desperation,he's woke up at 6:00 am by the same song at the radio and meets always the same people who obviously don't realize what is going on and can't understand his drama. I think this one the best comedy of the 90s not only for the Brilliant performance of Bill Murray (absolutely perfect in this role)but in particular for the deeper meaning of the story. In fact Phil's life is a disaster he's selfish,presumptuous, cinic and only when he changes his nature,stopping to use this absurd situation for his goals ,things will be better for him and the 2nd of February finally will be the 3rd!.So knowing perfectly the things of the day he's forced to live ever he starts helping people : save a child who's falling form a tree,save a man hit by an heart attack and so on in this way he also conquest the woman of his dreams (Andy McDowell).So this film is  a metaphor.Each of us after all live always the same day (wake at the same time,make the same job,see the same people)without realizing it,maybe we should make like Phil and try to change ,even just a bit,to be better person and to feel better ,is it so difficult ?..
I know it through a book called Mindset-.... of PhD Dweck. And I just watched the review of Groundhog Day but it presents the movie so well. This is a meaningful movie.
This is the best movie i have ever seen in my life. You just can't compare this to another movie. All of you people out there must realize this is simply the best film ever made.

reviews.review_title: This is a funny movie, this is a funny movie, this is a funny movie, and then it ends
reviews.content: The power of this movie is that it goes on and on and on just as the story. As soon as the movie stops repeating itself, it becomes a boring Hollywood flick. Nevertheless the repeating is so funny the movie is well above average.

This movie has always been a childhood favourite of mine and one I consider to be one of the most rewatchable movies of all time. I still watch it over and over and never get tired of it. Bill Murray is a legend, and he was top notch in this movie. The plot of this movie is also creative, a weatherman who does a report on the groundhog and has to relive Groundhog's day every single day and he eventually loses his mind and ends up breaking the law and doing crazy things since he wakes up everyday starting the day all over again. I give this movie a 10/10 for it's witty humor, it's memorable characters and storyline.

reviews.review_title: The definition of the successful sureal comedy!
reviews.content: Immaculate! The direction of this surreal plot is excelent and together with Bill Murray's unprecedented performance, it is undoubtly one of the best comedies. Best pick would be the scene where Bill Murray dives from the bell-tower (campanario/champagnerie) in slow motion wearing pyjamas, rain coat and gloves. His expression together with the Howard Shorish soundtrack manages to capture the apotheosis of utter despair. Must see at least thrice.

Groundhog Day is of the funniest movies ever released or even remotely thought up of by cinema makers. Bill Murray is at his greatest with outstanding lines of sarcastic replies and obvious insults to whoever his victim may be. Harold Ramis wrote and directed this film, as he has so many other fine pieces of film. Ramis also had a small role as a doctor in this film. Andie McDowel had a key role in this movie as the woman Murray's character is in love with. I usually find McDowel's accent and her acting quite annoying, but this is one of her better films. Saturday Night Live's Chris Elliott had a supporting role as "Larry" and he played his part very well. I believed he was better than Andie McDowel in some certain points. There is nothing that is not funny about this very entertaining film. Groundhog Day is about one man's experience through a day of hell that will never end- Groundhog Day. He tries to shoot,electrocute,stap,get run over by a Semi truck, but he always wakes up on one day- Groundhog Day. The "Academy" failed to award an outstanding film the awards it deserved. Groundhog Day is a film that all should experience. Bill Murray will definitely make you laugh. I would highly recommend that you rent this film because it is a highly wonderful piece of entertainment that all will enjoy!

reporter couvered the groundhogday, but he was egoistic and impolite to all this people.because of this he woke up and it was every morning the same day it. he meet a lot of people and learned thinks about all citizens in this small town named punxsutawney. He meet the producer and change his personalty. finally he fall in love with his producer and it had a happy end. we watched this movie in my culture class and we had no popcrond :) . but i learnd a little bit about American tradition. it was nice to learn morn about the USA and learn more personalty. i love American movies a lot and speaking about this is interesting to see how much money the producer spend to make a film.

reviews.review_title: Not worth it unless you're watching it for nostalgia
reviews.content: Groundhog day should've stayed in the 90s. I'm watching it for the first time in 2021 and I can say that the only way this movie would be good is if I was watching it for nostalgic reasons. Just like Shrek.

This became an instant favourite of mine the first time I watched it all those years ago, and that has never changed no matter how many times I've watched it. Which is appropriate given the context of the storyline.The comedy is intelligent and delivered with perfect timing. Credit has to go to the casting as everyone is perfectly suited to each role.There are a few life lessons which can be learned in becoming a better person.I also read once that Harold Ramis (who wrote the story) believed that Phil relived this same day over a 1000 years. That's enough to drive anyone to suicide :)I own this on DVD, but still watch it if it's shown on TV.Enjoy!

Harold Ramis's film "Groundhog Day" revolves around bill Murrays character "Phil", a miserable weatherman forced to once again go on assignment to Pauxatuany to cover the annual Groundhog Day celebration. After forcing his way through the day his team encounters a blizzard on the way home which forces them to turn around. He awakes the next day to find that it is the day he just lived. Hilarity ensues and in the end he discovers he must find happiness and his true self before he is able to snap out of his funk. He falls in love with his coworker Rita played by Andie MacDowell and they live happily ever after. The theme of this film kind of reminds me of Jerry McGuire except it is actually funny.Before Phil can overcome his miserable existence and find true happiness he is forced to relive the same day over and over again until he gets it right. Faced with seeing Ned, the annoying insurance salesman, everyday this takes some time. Phil experiences all the ranges of emotions while working to the end product and the director does a great job of taking us through them. He tries everything to get the day to end before realizing that he needs to embrace the day and make the best of it.The author uses several good techniques to reinforce the theme throughout the movie. I feel that "I got you babe" music every morning he wakes up is a nice touch in reference to the happiness he finds at the end of the film with Rita. The lighting is also used to reinforce how gloomy and dull both the town of Pauxotowny is and also the existence that Phil is living. While this film is a comedy classic, it also shows a real lesson that people take for granted most of the time. We go to work every day and get into the same rut over and over without putting everything into perspective. This film shows that sometimes we need to take a step back and evaluate what is important to us and spend the time putting it into perspective.

The movie gets entertaining quick. It's kind of cynic comedy gets to you and is all well the majority of the time. Although the end does play out like this has been a long time fantasy from the director.Could have been a 9 but its ending felt like, I dunno, unearned? This guy gets to be a creepy dick for 80% of the movie, then suddenly maxes-out his capabilities at everything, of course, and gets the girl. Yep. The more I think about it, the less I want to rate this, but it was a fun time regardless, so here this goes.

reviews.review_title: A weatherman is sent to cover a story about a groundhog named Punxsutawney Phil.
reviews.content: A weatherman is sent to cover a story about a groundhog named Punxsutawney Phil. He is not happy about covering the story because this is his third year. After doing the story and awaking the following day he discovers that "Groundhog Day" is happening all over again, and again, and again. He at first goes crazy about it and then he starts to realize that he can use this to his advantage. He then realizes that he will spend the rest of his life in the same place, with the same people doing the same thing. Phil Conners is the selfish weatherman for the local station WPBH-TV, Pittsburgh. He has no respect for hi co-workers as well as the viewers. He absolutely hates "Groundhog Day" which is held in Punxsutawney, Pennsylvania. Phil is to cover this event with Rita and Larry who are the new producer and cameraman. After doing the broadcast Phil wants to leave Punxsutawney, Pennsylvania immediately. However, a snowstorm leaves them spending another night. When Phil wakes the next morning he believes he is experiencing déjà vu because he is reliving Groundhog Day all over again. He keeps reliving this day after day after day. He realizes that this may be his fate but also figures out that his actions have no consequences, but the knowledge can help him gain information about what he wants especially when it comes to Rita. Phil is given ample opportunity time after time to get the day "right". Just like in the movie "50 First Dates" where a veterinarian has to keep winning the heart of a girl he fell in love with because she has a short term memory. With every new day he has to start over and make sure he gets it right. In this movie the motif is relevant to this movie because it is where they keep repeating the same day. This is important because it helps the view to understand the theme of the movie. The lighting in this movie was high-key lighting which helped create an effective image for the viewers. All Phil Conners had to do was get the day "right". Until this happened he would keep reliving the same day. This helped him gain knowledge on some stuff he needed but it also helped him realize that he would spend the rest of his life with the same people doing the same thing every day. He was given plenty of days to get it right.

reviews.review_title: My favorite movie of all time. Watch this movie!
reviews.content: This movie nothing short of fantastic -- one of the most under-rated movies of all time.  I've watched it more than a dozen times, and I'll never tire of it.  It is totally entertaining, totally thought provoking, and totally inspirational.  Every time I watch it I feel like a new man, with a new day before me in which I can do anything I want.  What a feeling!  My hat is off to Harold Ramis, Danny Rubin, Bill Murray and Andie MacDowell.Go for it!  Watch this movie!

I am totally flabbergasted and delighted to see the amazing number of comments here that agree with me that Groundhog Day is one of the greatest films ever made - yup, pure and simple it is right there at the top. The redemption of a slime-ball weatherman who will become a first class mensch is so like the story of Ebenezer Scrooge and is so well done without heavy moralizing or propagandizing. Bravo to a first class team who made this first class movie. Yes, I can watch this movie over and over again and enjoy it even more than the first time.Bill Murray"s character's sense of utter desolation is priceless when he says ,"And the worst of it is that tomorrow you will not even remember this.." He brings to us this message of how important it is to avoid that tragedy of a meaningless life.This is a great movie indeed.

reviews.review_title: Flawless comedy with Bill Murray's best performance
reviews.content: My favourite film.So you have to relive the same day over and over again? Think of what you would do? Harold Ramis did and developed it into this wonderful movie. Its an interesting premise for a film, Bill Murray as a obnoxious weatherman is trapped in a day he cant escape - no matter what he does every morning he wakes and its Groundhog day again. There's no explanation of how this happened to him (good!!) but its great watching him deal with it.  His main challenge is to make Andi Mcdowell love him and his attempts are wonderfully funny.  If you haven't seen it, watch it now, if you have watch it again. See it for the laughs, for Andi Mcdowell's beauty, for the performance of a great cast (Bill Murray is truly superb), see it to make life feel a little bit better.

Other viewers said it's a really funny movie well I dissagree with them it wasn't that funny but it is a great movie too watch. Bill Murray did some great acting trying first too make everything perfect, that alone took him several years, too win Rita's heart and get her into bed. That didn't work and he gave up for a while then Rita said something that was the turning point. The character went from rude and cyincal too caring and nice.
What made him relive the day over and over again? In my opinion it could be several things. 1 being the blizzard 2 the ground hog 3 other viewers mentioned this first learning too love himself before he could love another and win their love in return, what makes me think of Beauty of the Beast.

I love this movie for all the obvious comedic reasons, but what makes it special for me is how it perfectly captured 4 years of my life at my companies regional meetings. We literally discussed word for word the same issues and solutions for 4 straight years every three months. The only thing different was the backgrounds of the power-point presentations and the % differences in growth quarter after quarter. About 3 meetings into this trend, I dubbed our meetings groundhog day. Did they change? Sadly no, they just started saying, "we want to avoid another 'groundhog day' in every presentation. I hope you are able to avoid this tragedy at your company. Great movie, and hilarious business analogy.

What makes Groundhog Day special is that it is not only philosophically deeper than most movies, but also socially relevant.  How many people in this world have often felt like they're living the same day over and over again?  So many that Groundhog Day has now become a synonym for a monotonous lifestyle.  People can often be heard saying, "I feel like I'm in Groundhog Day."  How many movies have inspired a new expression in the English language?  Not many.While Jimmy Stewart's George Bailey finds out what life would be like had he never existed, Bill Murray's Phil Connors finds out what it's like to exist without consequences, to live like there's no tomorrow.  I have often seen similarities between Stewart and Murray, and would say they are parallels of two different generations.  Both are actors that are likeable enough to carry any movie.  And Groundhog Day is Murray's best movie (so far).I won't say much more about the movie because it's rich enough with meaning that it could be interpreted in many other ways.  In fact, it's nearly impossible to cover everything that I got out of this movie.

I think this movie is really good and worth of your time and money. I think that it's great how Phil learns from his mistakes. This movie is funny enough to watch over and over again and never get bored. Bill Murray does a great job of acting in this film, and he makes you believe that it is really happening in real life. Please, watch this movie, you'll love it.

I finally saw this movie years after it came out, and was blown away.--SPOILER AHEAD-- It hit me that it was in a sense a re-doing of "Beauty and the Beast". In that story, the Beast could not be transformed until he had truly won the love of the girl. Here, Bill Murray could not get out of the endless loop until he won the love of the girl.The movie sort of felt like a fable, as day piled upon endless day. I also thought it did a good job of taking Murray through the various stages: Denial; anger; trying to take advantage of the situation; and finally acceptance and grace in dealing with his situation.IMHO even though this movie is generally well-regarded, I think it is under-appreciated. I think it is a very well-done version of a timeless fable.

I rather enjoyed this film, only because I have always been a Bill Murray fan, like I said it's a fun film to watch, if there is nothing better on TV. But if you really want a funny Bill Murray film; try Ghostbusters or Caddyshack.

reviews.review_title: What if there was no tomorrow... there wasn't today????
reviews.content: This is a movie you will love or hate! Many people love and many more people love it! The basic plot of the movie is like this... There is this news reporter guy that goes to report on the Groundhog's day activities in PA.  He hates his job and pretty much everything about his life and he enjoys being a jerk to anyone and everyone he can. He ends up spending day after day after day in the same exact location. Each morning he wakes up and it is the same day. There have been many papers/ stories written on the idea of immortality and this story is one of the best. It asks the question how should you spend your life here on earth.  It is a very funny movie and it doesn't get too much into ethical issues.  What would you do with yourself if you had like 10 years to do nothing???I loved it and I let people know that I loved it!

Despite having read the reviews, I just wasn't ready for what a delight this film was. I'm normally not a fan of the "smarmy" school of humor that's so popular with the original bunch of Saturday Night Live alums: Chase, Belushi, Murray, et al. The "humor" in their characters all too often consists of them being "cooler" than the rest of the world, and laughing at those less "cool". And if you want to be "cool", too, you'd better laugh with them. It's humor as high school clique. Of the lot of them, I've always found Bill Murray to be the most tolerable; but even he rode the edge of my tolerance.But in this film, that's the point! Murray starts out as EXACTLY the smarmy character who annoys me so much; and because of who he is, he can't quite get his life to work out right. But through a little bit of Twilight Zone logic, he keeps getting chances to do it right. What seems like a curse at first -- repeating the same day over and over -- turns into an opportunity for him to grow as a character and as a human being.At the end, the smarm is still there; but it's turned inward, and becomes more self deprecating. Murray's character no longer views himself as the cool outsider, laughing at all the rubes. Instead, he joins the rubes -- the human race -- and laughs at life and love and himself. This transformation seems very natural, and makes for an irresistible film.

Groundhog Day has quite the fame of being this unique classic. In that regard, Groundhog Day is a fairly entertaining story about redemption and self-discovery of one's own behavior. It has Bill Murray in a performance that boasts toward both the devilish and the heartfelt and a safely entertaining amount of jokes and gags. Some of its middle, mainly how the character of Bill Murray deals with his condition, feels somewhat unbeliavable, but the movie quickly finds a way to remind you of the charm it carries.Andie MacDowell and Bill Murray portrait two characters whose development and conclusion allude to the various themes of Groundhog Day and, at the end of the day, are the main ingredient in the sucess of the movie's charm.
A great film & story looking at the process of maturity & life reflection.

reviews.review_title: This is not just a Comedy:
reviews.content: This is not just a comedy gives you a dry laugh. I believe this is a comedy with good philosophy content. In a sense most of us are repeating our lives over and over again. Get out form the bed, go to work, go lunch at some deli, go home at 5¡K Everyday is the same day like yesterday, nothing exciting happens. However, the important thing is how are we going to live today, the one just like every other day? The film used the groundhog festival wisely as a moral. Like Phil the groundhog, you can look at your own shadow in cold winter but do nothing, or you can use today to make a difference, open yourself to welcome a coming new Spring. Watch again the movie, you will find the message within this awesome film.Lynx

I have to admit to being a big fan of Bill Murray, but this is quite simply one of the best performances I have ever seen in a comedy.  Not only that but the story is intriguing, perfectly paced and transports you totally into its bizarre little scenario.I don't like to watch this too often to keep it fresh but I got it out the box again today and felt like a kid in a sweet shop!  Murray's timing and dead-pan delivery have never been put to better effect, the "You speak French?........oui!" scene almost gave me a prollapse.  Quite simply if you have not seen this, and you can easily suspend your sense of disbelief what are you waiting for.  Jim Carrey fans may not get some of the nuances but this is one film that gets better every time you watch it.

reviews.review_title: One of the greatest movies ever made
reviews.content: I truly believe that this is one of the greatest movies ever made.  Simply put, the premise of the movie is based upon the belief that we are doomed to repeat the errors of our lives unless we learn from them, but applies this principle literally to the main character Phil.I agree with some of the earlier comments that this is an inspiring movie that should be watched every few years to remind us what life is all about.That being said I have a question and a comment. After watching this movie again tonight I decided to look up the other credits for the writer.  I was sadly disappointed that there are not any other significant credits.  How is it that someone who created a work of art so clever and sublime, could not be more accomplished in the film industry?Second, It appears that this movie is a litmus test for personalities. People either love it or hate it.  I have seen this movie with several groups of people and have found that people who are annoyed by this film are also people that I don't care to associate with.

This is one of my top 5 movies of all time. It is one of a very short list that I have seen over 10 times. I never get bored with it because the setting of the movie is so convincingly laid out that you feel like you are able to spy on the characters as the story unfolds. This is a rare quality that I have only seen with a few other movies: "Fargo", "Cape Fear" (the one with DeNiro), and "It's a Wonderful Life" It is similar to how you would feel if you were able to see a film of close friends in an entertaining story. You feel as you know the people and the place. Fantastic! Bill Murray is Outstanding!! Chris Elliot is a funny supporting character. Andie McDowell, however, leaves question as to Bill Murray's Characters taste in women (a little too angelic for my taste - doesn't fit at all with his character). The townspeople have a strong role in this picture. They are the Currier and Ives simple-folk backdrop to Bill Murray's city-slicker character.

This light hearted comedy is perhaps Bill Murray's finest performance. Going through a renaissance of sorts since the Millennium, Murray has evolved into a much more serious actor.Deservedly Oscar nominated for "Lost In Translation" (2004), Murray is at his funniest all these years back in 1993. Rude and self obsessed to begin with, the transformation of Murray's character is pure genius as he relives the same day continuously until he learns the error of his ways and wins the girl (played surprisingly well by Andie MacDowell).The social commentary of this film is absolutely superb. The way Connors is able to often deceive others with prior knowledge is superb. As, most notably, is the way that Andie MacDowell's Rita can so magically change her opinion of Phil the second that she finds out that he plays an instrument. Rita is actually just as superficial as Connors and truthfully it would be brilliant to see how well the two coped over the following few months after the film ended.Personally the finest Philosophical story about this film is the death of the old homeless guy. Irrelevant of how Connors acts, this man always dies at the same point of the day. As the doctor says 'it was just his time'. This quote is brilliant because it suggests that however we live our lives, when we are due to die, we are due to die. This is one of the most important, most powerful, messages of the film, and it is delivered with subtlety and beauty. Full marks to director Harold Ramis for this one five minute period of skill.It's easy to over think the intelligence of "Groundhog Day". Yes first and foremost it is a comedy, but it is also incredibly easy to see more depth in a generally simple comedy. So, as a comedy, let us consider it's main points. Well, firstly it is a hilarious piece of work which is well written and adequately shot. Secondly it is brilliantly acted by everyone involved, including the usually awful Andie MacDowell.Finally, it is a feel good story which leaves you with a smile on your face. So whether you think of the film as being deep or whether you view it as a simple romantic comedy, it is perfect on either level. It is genuinely an excellent film.

I'm fairly certain that I have seen this movie at least 50 times and enjoy it very much. I have watched it 100% straight and 100% stoned on very good weed, my preference is to watch it quite stoned on primo bud. I have finally watched it so much that now I'm looking for real scientific miscalculations and the best that I can ascertain
is that there is one major inconsistency that just never gets thought about. Here it is: Phil is 100% aware that he is caught in a time-warp, reliving the same day continuously day after day. The inconsistency is that so does the rest of the town, except they are totally unaware that they too are living the same day over and over. Only Phil is aware that he has an ability to constantly change and improve. Everyone else experiences change,
but they are blissfully unaware that they too are reliving "Groundhog Day" over and over as well.Plus, there is the inconsistency of Phil predicting events that stay the same day after day, yet other events change day after day. I've always watched this without questioning that genuine scientific impossibility, even though I very much believe in the possibility that someday mankind might discover a secret wormhole that allows for time travel and existence in two places at the same time. The fact that astrophysics is coming around to believing the universe actually folds in upon itself, thus paving the way for wormholes to actually exist gives me far more comfort than believing in the concept of "God's" existence.

Inspires me a lot.. 
Sometimes we need to take break from life itself like giving a pause to life, I guess.
That's why death is there to keep life valuable.
also if we keep taking break, then there will be no fear of death.. :) I believe

I liked this movie! I really thought it was about an 10 on the scale, but just couldn't quite pull the trigger on a 9.I probably should have given it a 11 for the simple reason that it was VERY clever. How many hundreds of movies have we seen about time travel? And, how many times have we seen someone interact with another person in their early lives? But, to be able to interact with YOURSELF - and for both parties to know it - and to be able for both parties to teach the other something valuable that changes their lives - is really remarkable. And, if you think I am telling you the punch line, I'm not. There is a little more of a twist to it. Not quite the Sixth Sense, mind you, but a little surprise at the end.It was simple, sweet and even a little romantic. I would strongly recommend it for anyone. Interestingly, the survey of reviewers in Entertainment Weekly averaged a B- as I recall, but someone gave it a D. Seriously, they have to be out of their mind.Groundhog Day is awesome fun.

This film is definitely a contender for the funniest film of the nineties.Bill Murray plays Phil Connors, a cynical weatherman who, while covering a story about the "Weather predicting" groundhog, becomes trapped in a time warp which makes him live the same day over and over again.A hilarious turn from Bill Murray is what lifts this film from being a good comedy into an excellent one. The rest of the cast pale in comparison. A great star and a great script make this an unmissable film.
This movie is a timeless classic. Murray is the wise cracking cynical weather man whose life is dramatically changed when he is trapped in the same day for 34 years...

This movie is incredible. It is definitely my favorite movie of all time. It's one of those films that could not be pulled off by any other actor.... only Bill Murray could fit this role as Phil Conners, and he fits it perfectly. The incredible extent of his whimsical acting in this film is 80% of what makes it one of the greatest films I have ever seen... the other 20% belonging to the great storyline and supporting characters.This movie can be viewed at any time and still liked. It is a peaceful movie, if you are in relaxed spirits. It is especially great for those nights when you just got home from work or school and the day didn't go as you wanted it to, and you feel though as if life is struggle to no end. This movie is about second chances, and outside of the incredible humor, can be inspiring to get every day of your life right, and to remember the things that are most important in life.Watch it, and see what you think!

I never saw this movie until it had been out on video for a few years, which is a terrible shame - the story is top-notch, the acting is the best you can about find anywhere and it seems almost effortless for the two main characters (Murray & MacDowell).You perhaps have an understanding of the movie, but if not here is the "Reader's Digest" version (note that there's not really a plot "spoiler", per se, but I'll touch on what goes on later in the movie...if that's an issue to you, perhaps you should forego my review until you've seen the movie).Phil Connors (Murray) is a cranky, self-righteous, spoiled weatherman. He has little use for people in general, yet yearly he has to return to the humble Punxsutawney, PA to showcase whether or not Phil (the groundhog, not Murray) sees his shadow or not. This makes him incredibly miserable, having to deal with and interact with the local rural folks, making him feel as though he's trapped in his own private hell for that day.Well, they get stranded in the wonderful, bustling mecca that is Punxsutawney (are you getting my sarcasm? (I can say that 'cuz I'm originally from Johnstown, PA)) and to make matters worse, someone is seeing to it that Phil is forced to repeat this day, with memories and awareness intact no less, ad nauseum, all the while perfecting himself in the process.A terrific feel-good movie that has a great replay value. I've been watching it every Groundhog day now for several years, just to make sure I'm always aware of how great this movie is.Definitely a keeper - buy it, don't rent it.

reviews.review_title: A briliant comedy with an important theme
reviews.content: For a comic mastermind, Harold Ramis has made a brilliant film that deals with the universal human spirituality and the importance of personal contributions to the world we live in.  The beauty of this film is that a concept as utterly impossible as repetition of time is made completely and undeniably believeable, and then used to comment on the need for selflessness in today's society.  In my notes from this film, I find the quote, `since time and talents are all we have, that's what we should give.' Groundhog Day delivers this powerful warhead in the non-threatening missile of a Bill Murray comedy.  Although zany and comedic, the movie has an intended message within the script, that selflessness is both a virtue to be strived for and not a characteristic to be ashamed of.  If this film had just been written as a screwball comedy, and Ramis had tried to include the theme secondhand, the message would have no power.  Morality and message never works when injected into a film de facto; they only appear as contrived and misplaced. This film is a perfect blend of comedy and serious introspective reflection for me.  In my personality, just as in the movie, I can effectively juxtapose desires to strive for selflessness and generosity with quotes like `I was in the Virgin Islands once. I met a girl. We ate lobster and drank pina coladas. At sunset we made love like sea otters. That was a pretty good day. Why couldn't I get that day over and over and over?'  Crass comedy doesn't get anywhere with me, but I can appreciate a joke like that.  I think it's just my convert sense of humor, which sometimes does me more harm then good. It is a disappointment that much of today's comedy has departed from clever comedy with a positive theme to crass scatological humor or anger-laced ranting.  The classic comedies of the eighties and early nineties have given way at the box office to films like American Pie, Dude Where's My Car, and Saving Silverman.  At least when Groundhog Day had a sexual joke it was done tastefully.  We've degraded drastically from clever word play and wit to adolescents fornicating with pastries on camera.  I'll stay with the oldies, but the goodies.

reviews.review_title: A great movie that stands up to repeated viewings.
reviews.content: Groundhog Day is one of those movies that is worth getting the DVD. Not for the picture quality - which is good, nor for the surround sound track - which is there but not remarkable, but because the movie is so carefully crafted. Anytime you repeatedly watch a movie, you become aware of details in the background. You'll find very few slip ups in Groundhog Day. And, the details in the background enhance the experience. It's fun to watch the supporting characters interact when they are not up front. This is one of the few movies to do this. And, it's important due to the premise of the movie itself.The lead-in song "I'm Your Weatherman" just draws you into the movie every time. I'm always anxious to get to Gobbler's Knob each time I hear that song. The change in Bill Murray's character, from a sarcastic, self-centered individual to the kind, caring person we see at the end is a satisfying conclusion - but does require the viewer to accept quite a bit. Especially considering how the whole town raves about Phil and all the things he has done on the final repetition! I have my doubts whether there are enough minutes in the day to do all the good deeds that Phil did on that one day.We are never really told what caused Phil to have to repeat the same day over and over. In this case, that's good, as it leaves it to your imagination. However, the clues are there at the exact moment when the repetition finally ends.A great (but not perfect), upbeat, entertaining movie that's worth watching again and again!

Groundhog Day is wonderful for its comedy, but its lesson of morality is timeless.Hearkening to Kubrick's (and Burgess's) A Clockwork Orange, Groundhog Day provides singular insight toward the human dilemma of what it means to be good.Goodness cannot be forced by authority, was the lesson from Alex and his Droogs.  Phil Connnors teaches us that acts of altruism must be performed for the sake of altruism -- not for any material or personal gain. Kindness, self-improvement, sincerity... these are rewards in and of themselves.  Murray's comic wit and deadpan face imparts this message with more warmth than any actor has before or since.When you forget what it means to be selfless, Groundhog Day should be the movie in your VCR.

reviews.review_title: Can watch it over and over again
